paper.title: Transverse Activities: Abstractions in Object-Oriented Programming
paper.venue: Proceedings of the First JSSST International Symposium on Object Technologies for Advanced Software
paper.abstract: A transverse activity is an activity executed by several objects in some combination. The activity is described as a single unit, separately from the descriptions of the participating objects. A transverse activity is described and executed by using the usual object-centric actions, i.e. the methods of the objects, and is seen as a natural supplement to the description of the cooperation of active objects.
